src.analysis package¶

src.analysis.analyse module¶

src.analysis.analyse.correlation_matrix(dataset)¶

Create a correlation matrix with seaborn lib, save it as png into ./analysis/

Once the correlation matrix is created it’s shown on screen.

Parameters

dataset (DataFrame) – Pandas DataFrame object

Returns

None

src.analysis.analyse.mae(y_test, y_pred)¶

Compute the mean absolute error with sklearn lib

Parameters

  • y_test (array-like) – labels that correspond to the values of test dataset

  • y_pred (array-like) – labels that are predicted by the model based on values of test dataset

Returns

(float) - the mean absolute error

Raises

Exception – the arguments don’t have same shapes

src.analysis.analyse.r2(y_test, y_pred)¶

Compute the r-square score with sklearn lib

Parameters

  • y_test (array-like) – labels that correspond to the values of test dataset

  • y_pred (array-like) – labels that are predicted by the model based on values of test dataset

Returns

(float) - r-square score

Raises

Exception – the arguments don’t have same shapes

src.analysis.analyse.rmse(y_test, y_pred)¶

Compute the root-mean-square error with sklearn lib

Parameters

  • y_test (array-like) – labels that correspond to the values of test dataset

  • y_pred (array-like) – labels that are predicted by the model based on values of test dataset

Returns

(float) - the root-mean-square error

Raises

Exception – the arguments don’t have same shapes
